revised_title: Inhibitory Synaptic Currents in Voltage-clamped Locust Muscle Fibres
tldr: The study examines inhibitory junctional currents in voltage-clamped locust muscle fibers that have been desensitized to their excitatory transmitter. The research focuses on the properties of GABA-activated channels and the analysis of miniature inhibitory junctional currents, providing insights into inhibitory transmission mechanisms.
